document_data.name: Alembrosius
document_data.mainbody:
'''Alembrosius''' was a child who worked with his mother selling pottery and [[ceramic]]s in [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{quote|''Oh... do you actually want one? Sorry... erm... can't sell you any right now, but you can look! Mum'll be back soon. I mean—''ahem''—shopkeeper'Il be back soon.''|Alembrosius}}
document_data.Description: In his childhood, Alembrosius was a boy with olive skin, light brown eyes, and curly, shiny black hair. He wore simple commoner's garb and a [[leather]] jerkin vest.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Alembrosius helped his mother out with her pottery business. The mother ran a shop selling ceramics from her home, offering vase repair services to clients from across the city and the [[Baldur's Gate/Upper City|Upper City]]. When she was out making deliveries or doing other business, Alembrosius was left in charge of the street-side stall, advertising the pottery and asking those interested to return soon once his mother was back to perform transactions.
